weeklyTopNews.title: Victorians must not go to work with coronavirus symptoms or lockdown 'will not end', Dan Andrews says
weeklyTopNews.summary: Victoria Premier Daniel Andrews has revealed that Victorians who go to work while displaying coronavirus symptoms are the "biggest driver of transmission" and added that the lockdown will not end until people instead get tested and isolate while waiting for results. Victoria recorded its highest daily increase in cases today with 532 people testing positive. Andrews warned all Victorians, no matter where they work, to "act on your symptoms, don't ignore them." "These are the facts and unless we see a change, then we're going to continue to see these numbers at unacceptably high levels," he added.

weeklyTopNews.title: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews gave an update on the state's coronavirus crisis. Here are some key takeaways
weeklyTopNews.summary: 10 more individuals have died in Victoria due to the coronavirus and 42 remain in intensive care. The state also recorded 459 new cases overnight. State Premier Daniel Andrews mentioned that he is, "very proud to see so many people wearing masks right across the city, particularly in regional Victoria, too, where it's not compulsory,"

weeklyTopNews.title: National cabinet commits to Covid-19 suppression strategy to secure zero community transmissions
weeklyTopNews.summary: After a meeting on Friday, the national cabinet has agreed to share more data and COVID-19 testing response times, and have committed to a virus with a goal of having zero community transmissions. There is now acceptance in the national cabinet that all states and territories need to take precautions to avoid community transmission, currently only occurring in Victoria and New South Wales.

weeklyTopNews.title: Victoria records five deaths and 403 new cases of coronavirus overnight
weeklyTopNews.summary: Three of the deaths are connected to aged care facilities. The five deaths bring the state's total death toll to 49.

weeklyTopNews.title: Victorian coronavirus cases hit new record high with 484 cases, two more deaths
weeklyTopNews.summary: Victoria have broken a record with 484 new coronavirus cases announced. Victorian Premier, Daniel Andrews has said that he is, "very unhappy and very sad", aknowledging a report stating that report that nearly nine in 10 people did not isolate between the time they first felt sick and when they went to get a test. After testing, half of these people did not isolate while waiting for their test results. "Fifty-three per cent of people continuing to do their shopping, continuing to go to work continuing to do all sorts of things," he said. "Unless people who get tested are staying at home and isolating until they get their test results, then we will not see those numbers come down," he said before adding that the six week lockdown might be extended.

weeklyTopNews.title: Jobkeeper and jobseeker payment: what do the changes mean for recipients?
weeklyTopNews.summary: Jobkeeper has now been extended to 28 March 2021. The Jobkeeper rate will change after 27 Septmeber. It is currently at $1500 per employee per fortnight, but after 27 September, employees who ordinarily worked fewer than 20 hours a week will have reduced payments. Jobkeeper is also set to reduce payments over time. The coronavirus supplement for recipients of Jobseeker, will be cut from $550 per fortnight, to $250 per fortnight from 25 September onwards. The supplement will remain in place until 31 December.

weeklyTopNews.title: New Tasmanian coronavirus case confirmed as young woman returning from Victoria
weeklyTopNews.summary: Tasmania has recorded its first coronavirus cases in over 2 months. Before this, the state had recorded no active cases as of June 12th. The new case is a person that is currently in hotel quarantince since returning to Tasmania from Victoria. Tasmania Premier, Peter Gutwein has said that there were about 600 people in hotel quarantine in the state, and a further 1,000 in home quarantine.
